newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ debt markets finish week on positive note.
newsitem.headline: NZ debt markets finish week on positive note.

text.p: * NZ bond yields finish week slightly lower
* Key US payrolls report tonight to be watched closely
New Zealand bonds finished the week on a positive note at Friday's close, with most yields coming off a couple of points in thin trade.
However, the 7/98s finished where they opened at 7.67 percent, after correcting from Thursday's rally down to 7.58 percent on the back of a short squeeze.
"They were always going to be the underperformer on the day -- it was pretty inevitable they'd come back given the magnitude of yesterday's move," one dealer said.
"It's probably a good thing. It can put a few offshore investors off when you get a bond going so far below the curve -- just the fact that this market can produce such a big squeeze," he added.
Ninety-day bank bills were up three basis points at the close as the Trade-Weighted Index climbed to 66.77 from its 66.71 close last night. Cash came down on the day to 9.95 percent from 10 percent.

Dealers said the tone going into next week would be determined by U.S. payrolls data due after the local close. U.S. Treasuries extended their recent bullish trend in Tokyo trading and were supported ahead of the jobs data.
NZD VS 3 YR 10 YR * NZD 3-YR/10-YR SPREAD
